title: Which migration is the most important in US history? - Quora
tags: History of the United States of America

response.answer_text: I would say, the forced migration of Native peoples, Cherokees, Choctaw, Chickasaw, Creek Confederation, Seminole, etc. from the Southeastern U.S. to the Oklahoma territory, as abhorrent as they were, were the most important. These trails of tears had the effect of opening up that land to white migrants, and spurned another equally abhorrent migration, that of enslaved African Americans, torn away from their families to plant and harvest cotton in the newly vacated territory. These migrations had a great impact on how the U.S. would develop, to include the sectional strife that nearly tore it apart.
6 million African Americans moving from South to North in 30s and 40s
